page.title: 06HOUSING IN BLOFIELD
page.content: The majority of houses in Blofield are new like the ones in the Danesbower Lane area, which are mostly detatched houses. These have very little gardens but the houses are quite large with on average nine rooms. Some of the houses in Blofield are semi_detached built in the 1940s again with small gardens. There are also a few in Skedge Way for example. But there are a few houses which were built in the 19th Century, Turret House is one of these built in 1832. These houses have very large grounds like Blofield House has. All the houses mainly surround the shops in Blofield. The other houses seem to branch off from these and are surrounded by arable fields and fruit farms, but some farm houses are quite isolated.
